intro: Tetramerium fruticosum, commonly known as the creeping tetramerium, is a low-growing shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, small leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, red or orange fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
